snippet.title: Why the U.S. government is 'trolling' jihadists on social media
snippet.description:
* "We don't negotiate with terrorists," has long been the standard refrain of governments when it comes to violent extremists.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/18/world/jihadist-twitter-state-department-trolls-terrorists/index.html

snippet.title: The internal debate Saudi Arabia needs to have
snippet.description:
* By Fahad Nazer, Special to CNN Editor’s note: Fahad Nazer is an analyst at JTG, Inc. and a former political analyst at the Embassy of Saudi Arabia in Washington, DC. His writing has appeared in The New York Times, CNN, Foreign Policy and Al Monitor...
http://globalpublicsquare.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/08/the-internal-debate-saudi-arabia-needs-to-have/

snippet.title: NYPD's Twitter campaign was a fiasco
snippet.description:
* Whoever is running the social media strategy for the New York Police Department needs to be fired because that person has no idea how to follow the rules of social media.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/24/opinion/robbins-nypd-twitter/index.html

snippet.title: Hamas, Fatah announce talks to form Palestinian unity government
snippet.description:
* Rival Palestinian factions Hamas and Fatah announced Wednesday they've agreed to reconcile -- a development that could see the Palestinian territories under a unified leadership for the first time in years.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/23/world/meast/gaza-west-bank-palestinian-reconciliation/index.html

snippet.title: More than 10 million core users give value to Weibo ahead of lPO
snippet.description:
* As Weibo, the largest social media platform in China, gets ready for its initial public offering (IPO), a recent university study claims Chinese micro-blogging activity might not be as vibrant as expected.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/10/business/china-weibo-user-base/index.html

snippet.title: Cat Cafe unites friends of felines in New York
snippet.description:
* Along the Bowery in Manhattan, people waited in a line that would challenge any fancy art gallery opening or exclusive New York City club.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/24/us/new-york-cat-cafe/index.html

snippet.title: How big a threat is nationalism to Asia's stability?
snippet.description:
* By Jason Miks GPS Digital Producer Jason Miks speaks with Robert Kaplan, author of Asia's Cauldron: The South China Sea and the End of a Stable Pacific, and Geoff Dyer, author of Contest of the Century: The New Era of Competition with China-and How...
http://globalpublicsquare.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/25/how-big-a-threat-is-nationalism-to-asias-stability/

snippet.title: President Obama answers questions from the media
snippet.description:
* President Barack Obama: Hello, everybody. Before I begin I just want to express on behalf of the American people our deepest condolences to the Republic of Korea, and the families of all those who've seen their loved one last when I ferry sank within the last couple of days. Obviously information is still coming in. We know that many of the victims...
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/17/politics/obama-news-cobference-transcript/index.html

snippet.title: MH370: Narrowed underwater search nears end as officials plan next steps
snippet.description:
* The Bluefin-21's initial search is nearing its end. As the underwater sonar device plunged into the Indian Ocean, kicking off its 14th mission, authorities are focusing on what they will do if it comes up empty. That outcome would seem likely.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/25/world/asia/malaysia-airlines-plane/index.html
